title.bibl: Chinese Centralist Daily News, Sept. 28, 1937. Newly Elected Officers of the Chinese Association

div.bibl: Chinese Centralist Daily News, Sept. 28, 1937. NEWLY ELECTED OFFICERS OF THE CHINESE ASSOCIATION

body.p: The Chinese Association held a meeting on the 26th, electing its officers for the next term. The results were as follows:
1. T. W. Izu was elected as chairman ( or president) by 261 votes. He defeated three other candidates.
2. K. L. Chen was elected vice-president. (Chinese Secretary) by a vote of 308. His opponent had 236 votes.
3. M.T. Sheh was elected vice-president (Foreign Secretary) by 308 votes.
4. K. F. Chen was elected treasurer by 360 votes.
5. M.C. Chen was elected auditor by 397 votes.
6. Out of four candidates, W. Y. Li and S. F. Sheh were elected accountants. 305 and 179 votes respectively.
7. H. T. Kuon was elected office clerk by 326 votes.
All elected officers are eager to shoulder their duties in serving. The society and public congratulate them.
